caption_original: Did you know that climate change affects water levels? If you love the outdoors or enjoy fishing, this affects you, too. In the past few years, global warming has caused a drop in water levels in the Great Lakes and the St. Lawrence River upstream from Québec. The Government of Canada is working to enhance these ecosystems for future generations. http://ow.ly/ZE1Xy

caption_original:
50th Anniversary of the Great Winnipeg Blizzard 

Winnipeg’s winter of early 1966 was the third coldest year of the century. To make matters worse, on March 4, 1966 a big snow storm piled up 38 cm and was driven by winds gusting up to 112 kilometers per hour. It was the worst winter storm ever recorded for Winnipeg since March 1902 and stranded thousands.

caption_original:
Did you know the Great Lakes contain roughly 20% of the world supply of surface freshwater, and 84% of North America’s supply? They are home to millions of people, and are fundamental to the well-being of 1/3 of the population of Canada and 1/10 of the population of the United States.

Follow @environmentca and #CanH20 on Twitter for more interesting Great Lakes facts.

Follow and on Twitter for more interesting Great Lakes facts.
